description: The course investigates issues in health-related settings using a quantitative,
research-oriented perspective. Course material focuses on global and public health
issues, study design, methods for analyzing health data, and communication of research
findings. Design topics include controlled trials, case-control, cohort and other
observational studies. Methods include survival analysis and causal inference for
observational studies. Communication emphasizes writing up findings and interpreting
published research. Also counts toward mathematical biology concentration.  Offered
alternate years during January term. Prerequisite: completion of SDS 272 or
